page.title: 01General Description of Area
page.content: The land is{agricultural,}mostly {grazing,}some{arable}and about one third is{woodland.}The land is high {(approx. 600 ft)}undulating ground, designated an area of{outstanding {natural beauty}and is much exposed to prevailing westerly winds. The county boundaries of{Dorset and Wiltshire } meet in the square{9517.}The road to {Shaftesbury}that turns off the main { {Salisbury to Blandford}road runs through this area, though there are other minor roads and ancient tracks. {Tollard Royal,}the only village in this area, is famous for its associat- ion with {King John}as the area is part of the once royal{Cranbourne {Chase. Rushmore House,}once the home of{General Pitt-Rivers }is now { {Sandroyd School.} {(AUTHOR: Philip Harry) { }
